sections.text: Shortly before the Covid-19 Pandemic landed in the UK, I took on the role of Head of Engineering, with Engineering Managers and Lead Engineers reporting to me. Currently the Charlotte Tilbury Engineering Team is over 25 people and growing. Having to learn to be a Manager of Managers as we went into Lockdown was a huge learning curve.

I've had to keep a close eye on team culture as we paid down feature debt, which was a tricky 12 months, but not I'm putting in place strategic goals and structures that will make the Charlotte Tilbury Engineering Team a stable and sustainable team.
As an Engineering Manager I had a small team and managed our Single Customer View Project. This was a high-ambiguity project with a very small team
Played a key role in replatforming the Charlotte Tilbury Website, splitting my time between performance reivews of the previous site and actively building the new one.
As Lead Engineer at WeSwap, I designed and rebuilt the WeSwap Exchange, a Peer-to-peer platform that swapped money reliably between people.
Department of Infectious Disease Epidemiology, Imperial College London
